text: On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed brown with a medium sized tanned white head. Sweet bready plums with a nice malt note to it. Soft stone fruit, musk, fruit and sweetness. Gentle musk, fruit. Slow and malty, toast with a bit of sweetness.
Draft at brewery. Light malty, nutty aroma. Medium brown with small ring of head. Taste dries out, wooden, nuts. Light bodied builds to crescendo rapidly, and then...Mild lingering palate.

Tap at Right Proper. Deep thick opaque brown malt. Underlying faint saison-esque yeast tones. Not really a fan of the aroma, light bakers chocolate. Ruby amber malt touches. Nutty mildness. Medium bodied session brown saison?

Keg @ Le Diplomate, DC. Deep chestnut brown with a small white head. Aroma is of toasty malt. Interesting yeast character. Autumn fruits, country meadow. Taste is dry, moderately bitter. Light nutty toasty malt. Medium body, active carbonation.

Where and how:  at brewpub 
Aroma: medium intense, nice rounded malts. Hops tad subdued. This one is more malt sided
 Appearance : 
Top: medium white cap.
Base: hazy amber
Palate : medium-thin bodied. Dry, with average finish. Good drinkability.
Taste: First things first. Its far too dry to be Alt. malty character was more evident in aroma. Taste presented to me as more of a saison/de garde in style with hits of Alt. 
 other notes  interesting hybrid, yet I wished to see more Alt in Alt.
A nice beer on a late summer day outside. Bought a few on draft during brunch, very mild and pleasant flavor.

Poured from a tap. Rich mahogany color, medium off white head. Medium malt fragrance. Medium body with a syrup malt and a light hops undertone seen in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewpub.
A good looking but unusual altbier with a Belgian (Saigon yeast) twist.
Slightly funky with a good, but relatively dark roasted, malt base.

Growler from the source.

Mahogany body with hints of burgundy and crimson. The beer hisses as the nearly two inches of sea foam head gradually dissipates. Dark fruits, spice, German sweet breads. Bready and yeasty, slightly sweet, finishing dry. Mild bitterness. Solid.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2015 12 oz pour on draft at Right Proper, consumed on 3/17/2015. Dark brown with off-white head. Aromas of roast, toast, oats, grains, chocolate and licorice. Tastes of roast, licorice, toasty notes, grains, light chocolate, malt. Medium body with a dry finish. 6/4/7/4/13

4 oz pour on draft at Right Proper, consumed on 10/19/2015. Clear dark amber with off-white head. Aromas of toasty and nutty notes, citrus. Tastes of biscuit, citrus, light toasty notes. Medium body with a dry finish. 7/4/8/4/15

Tap at the brewery. Pours clear dark amber with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is toast and bread malt, earthy and herbal hops, nutty notes and dates. Flavor is crisp toast malt, medium hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draft at the source. Very dark maroon brown color, thick cream colored head. Aroma of rich prunes, burnt winter fruit, butterscotch. Taste is very fruity plums, figs, prunes, raisins. Light body, very drinkable.

Draft. Medium off-white head that leaves nice lacing atop dark copper body. Aroma is medium sweet, lacto, some caramel, light smoke, earthy, chocolate. Taste is medium sweet, bread, some cherry, milk chocolate, light smoke/roast, sour. Light-medium body. Unlike any alt I can recall tasting.

Poured a light clear amber color with a small white head. Aroma was light malt character, touch of some light nutty notes. Flavor was light yeast, some dried fruits. Malts. Pretty clean and easy drinking, especially on a hot day.
Tap, DC, amber pour, white head, nose is cherry, taste is sweet, citrus, easy to drink.

[ Keg ][ 12oz ][ Right Proper ][ $5 ][ Small Wine Glass ][ 6.1.14 ]
>> Thanks DTF. Clear, light amber pour with okay white foam. Nose is dark cherry, alcohol, fig. Taste is light bodied, a bit watery, somewhat quenching given this style. Mildly bitter, mild lemon, not at all sticky. Seems to be balanced but not too expressive. Maybe one to pursue and tweak. Cant say Ive ever had a great Altbier.

12oz glass at the brewery. Pours a translucent copper amber with some sudsy white head. Nose is malty, mildly nutty, yeast, some dried fruit. Flavor is malty, sweet, hint of orange, cracker, bread crust. Clean finish.
Not a huge beer, and only an average showing for style. Pours brown with ok head and lacing. Some barley, some sweetness and light caramelized malt. Tap at brewpub.
